git history to bookdown

Source: R/git_down.R
git_down.Rd

This function turns the history of git into a bookdown. Each chapter is a group of commits. The first page gives a summary of all the groups.

git_down(repo = ".", book_path = "gitdown", open = TRUE,
  author = "John Doe", pattern, names_section, ref = "master")

Arguments

repo

The path to a repository. Default is `.`
book_path

The path to the bookdown output. Default is `"gitdown"`.
open

Should the bookdown be opened once compiled? Default is TRUE.
author

Author of the Bookdown
pattern

pattern to expose commits, like "#[[:digit:]]" for issues
names_section

names for each section, one pattern = one section
ref

the name of the branch, by default master

Contents

  • Arguments

gitdown is a ThinkR package. Learn more at rtask.thinkr.fr.
